org.kiji.rest.resources
Class RowsResource

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.rest.resources.RowsResource

@ApiAudience.Public
public class RowsResource
extends Object

This REST resource interacts with Kiji tables. This resource is served for requests using the resource identifier:

  • /v1/instances/<instance>/tables/<table>/rows

    Constructor Summary

    Default constructor.

    Parameters:
    kijiClient - that this should use for connecting to Kiji.
    jsonObjectMapper - is the ObjectMapper used by DropWizard to convert from Java objects to JSON.
    freshenConfig - to use with freshening reader.
    Method Detail

    getRows

    @ApiStability.Experimental
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getRows(String instance,
                                                                   String table,
                                                                   String jsonEntityId,
                                                                   String startEidString,
                                                                   String endEidString,
                                                                   int limit,
                                                                   String columns,
                                                                   String maxVersionsString,
                                                                   String timeRange,
                                                                   Boolean freshen,
                                                                   Long timeout,
                                                                   @Context
                                                                   javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo)
    GETs a list of Kiji rows.

    Parameters:
    instance - is the instance where the table resides.
    table - is the table where the rows from which the rows will be streamed
    jsonEntityId - the entity_id of the row to return.
    startEidString - the left endpoint eid of the range scan.
    endEidString - the right endpoint eid of the range scan.
    limit - the maximum number of rows to return. Set to -1 to stream all rows.
    columns - is a comma separated list of columns (either family or family:qualifier) to fetch
    maxVersionsString - is the max versions per column to return. Can be "all" for all versions.
    timeRange - is the time range of cells to return (specified by min..max where min/max is the ms since UNIX epoch. min and max are both optional; however, if something is specified, at least one of min/max must be present.)
    freshen - determines whether freshening should be done as part of the request.
    timeout - amount of time in ms to wait for freshening to finish before returning the old/stale/previous value of the column(s).
    uriInfo - contains all the query parameters.
    Returns:
    the Response object containing the rows requested in JSON

    postRows

    @ApiStability.Experimental
public Map<String,List<String>> postRows(String instance,
                                                                   String table,
                                                                   com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode kijiRestRows)
                                  throws IOException
    POSTs JSON body to row(s): performs create and update. The input JSON blob can either represent a single KijiRestRow or a list of KijiRestRows. For example, a single KijiRestRow: { "entityId":"hbase=hex:8c2d2fcc2c150efb49ce0817e1823d46", "cells":{ "info":{ "firstname":[ { "timestamp":123, "value":"John" } ] }, "info":{ "lastname":[ { "timestamp":123, "value":"Smith" } ] } } } A list of KijiRestRows: [ { "entityId":"hbase=hex:8c2d2fcc2c150efb49ce0817e1823d46", "cells":{ "info":{ "firstname":[ { "timestamp":123, "value":"John" } ] } } }, { "entityId":"hbase=hex:acfbe1234567890987654321abcfdega", "cells":{ "info":{ "firstname":[ { "timestamp":12312345, "value":"Jane" } ] } } } ] Note that the user-formatted entityId is required. Also note that writer schema is not considered as of the latest version.

    Parameters:
    instance - in which the table resides
    table - in which the row resides
    kijiRestRows - POST-ed json data
    Returns:
    a message containing the rowkey of interest
    Throws:
    IOException - when post fails
